response.answer_text: Correct but incomplete in isolation. The subject ‘it’ is unspecified’, what it? Also ‘it’ should be Upper case as the start of a sentence. As an answer to a question such as; “Are you going to the dance tonight?, you might answer “It is highly likely”, in which case it is a complete sentence. Also with the use of ‘highly’ it implies some force, so an exclamation mark at the end might be used.

Yes, since an adverb can modify a verb, adjective or another adverb. This is an adverb modifying an adjective (even though it looks like an adverb). Example: It is a highly likely outcome. “Likely” is an adjective modifying “outcome.” “Highly” is an adverb modifying “likely.”
